hillbillies.model

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Unit

  • public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of Units which can have a name, agility, strength, weight, toughness, maximum hitpoints, maximum staminapoints, current hitpoints, current staminapoints, orientation, cube coordinates, position, default behaviour, a Faction, a Task and several speeds. This Unit lives in a given World.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kevin Algoet & Jeroen Depuydt 1ba Informatica
    Invariants:
  • The name of each Unit must be a valid name for any Unit.
        isValidName(getName())
  • The strength of each Unit must be a valid property value for any Unit.
        isValidPropertyValue(getStrength())
  • The agility of each Unit must be a valid property value for any Unit.
        isValidPropertyValue(getAgility())
  • The toughness of each Unit must be a valid property value for any Unit.
        isValidPropertyValue(getToughness())
  • Each Unit can have its weight as its weight.
        canHaveAsWeight(getWeight())
  • The maximum hitpoints of each Unit must be valid points for any Unit.
        isValidPoints(getMaxHitpoint())
  • Each Unit can have its current hitpoints as its current hitpoints.
        canHaveAsCurrentHitpoints(getCurrentHitpoints())
  • The maximum staminapoints of each Unit must be a valid points for any Unit.
        isValidPoints(getMaxStaminaPoints())
  • Each Unit can have its current staminapoints as its current staminapoints.
        canHaveAsCurrentStaminapoints(getCurrentStaminapoints())
  • The orientation of each Unit must be a valid orientation for any Unit.
        isValidOrientation(getOrientation())
  • Each Unit can have its cube coordinates as its cube coordinates
        canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(getCubeCoordinates())
  • Each Unit can have its falling state as its falling state.
        canHaveAsFalling(isFalling())
  • Each Unit can have its current speed as its current speed.
        canHaveAsCurrentSpeed(getCurrentSpeed())
  • Each Unit can have its sprinting state as its sprinting state.
        canHaveAsIsSprinting(getIsSprinting())
  • Each Unit can have its moving state as its moving state.
        canHaveIsMoving(isMoving())
  • Each Unit can have its working state as its working state.
        canHaveAsIsWorking(isWorking())
  • This Unit can have its carrying log state as carrying log state.
        canHaveAsIsCarryingLog(getIsCarryingLog())
  • Each Unit must have a proper Log attached to it.
        hasProperLog()
  • This Unit can have its carrying boulder state as carrying boulder state.
        canHaveAsIsCarryingBoulder(isCarryingBoulder())
  • Each Unit must have a proper Boulder attached to it.
        hasProperBoulder()
  • Each Unit can have its resting state as its resting state.
        canHaveAsIsResting(isResting())
  • Each Unit can have its default behaviour state as its default behaviour state.
        canHaveAsIsDefaultBehaviour(isDefaultBehaviourEnabled())
  • Each Unit must have a proper Faction to which it is attached.
        hasProperFaction()
  • The experience of each Unit must be a valid experience for any Unit.
        isValidExperience(getExperience())
  • Each Unit must have a proper World to which it is attached.
        hasProperWorld()
  • Each Unit must have a proper Task to which it is attached.
        hasProperTask()
    • Note:
    Repository link: https://github.com/KivinA/ProjectOGP

    • Constructor Detail

      • Unit

        public Unit(java.lang.String name,
            int strength,
            int agility,
            int toughness,
            int weight,
            int[] initialPosition,
            boolean enableDefaultBehaviour,
            World world)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new Unit with a given name, strength, agility, toughness, weight, initial position, default behaviour and World.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this new Unit.
        strength - The strength for this new Unit.
        agility - The agility for this new Unit.
        toughness - The toughness for this new Unit.
        weight - The weight for this new Unit.
        initialPosition - The initial position for this new Unit.
        enableDefaultBehaviour - The enableDefaultBehaviour for this new Unit.
        world - The World in which this Unit lives.
        Postconditions:
      • The maxHitpoints of this new Unit is equal to a rounded integer which is 200 times a 100th of its weight times a 100th of its toughness.
            new.getMaxHitpoints() == (int)Math.round(200*((double)this.weight/100)*((double)this.toughness/100))
      • The maxStaminapoints of this new Unit is equal to a rounded integer which is 200 times a 100th of its weight times a 100th of its toughness.
            new.getMaxStaminaPoints() == (int)Math.round(200*((double)this.weight/100)*((double)this.toughness/100))
        • Effects:
      • The world of this new Unit is set to the given world.
            this.setWorld(world)
      • The name of this new Unit is set to the given name.
            this.setName(name)
      • If the given strength is a valid initial property value for any Unit, the strength of this new Unit is set to the given strength. Otherwise, the strength of this new Unit is set to the default property value.
            if (isValidInitialValue(strength))
             then this.setStrength(strength)
            else this.setStrength(DEFAULT_PROPERTY_VALUE)
      • If the given agility is a valid initial property value for any Unit, the agility of this new Unit is set to the given agility. Otherwise, the agility of this new Unit is set to the default property value.
            if (isValidInitialValue(agility))
             then this.setAgility(agility)
            else this.setAgility(DEFAULT_PROPERTY_VALUE)
      • If the given toughness is a valid initial property value for any Unit, the toughness of this new Unit is set to the given toughness. Otherwise, the toughness of this new Unit is set to the default property value.
            if (isValidInitialValue(toughness))
             then this.setToughness(toughness)
            else this.setToughness(DEFAULT_PROPERTY_VALUE)
      • If the given weight is a valid initial property value for any Unit, the weight of this new Unit is set to the given weight. Otherwise, the weight of this new Unit is set to the default weight.
            if (isValidInitialValue(weight))
             then this.setWeight(weight)
            else this.setWeight(getDefaultWeight())
      • Set the current hitpoints of this new Unit to the maximum hitpoints.
            this.setCurrentHitpoints(getMaxHitpoints())
      • Set the current staminapoints of this new Unit to the maximum staminapoints.
            this.setCurrentStaminapoints(getMaxStaminapoints())
      • The cubeCoordinates of this new Unit is set to the given initial position.
            this.setCubeCoordinates(initialPosition)
      • The isDefaultBehaviour of this new Unit is set to the given enableDefaultBehaviour.
            this.setIsDefaultBehaviour(enableDefaultBehaviour)
      • Set the experience of this new Unit to zero.
            this.setExperience(0)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • Unit

        @Deprecated
public Unit(java.lang.String name,
                         int strength,
                         int agility,
                         int toughness,
                         int weight,
                         int[] initialPosition,
                         boolean enableDefaultBehaviour)
                  throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Deprecated. 
        Initialize this new Unit with the given name, strength, agility, toughness, weight, initialPosition, enableDefaultBeahviour and no world.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this new Unit.
        strength - The strength for this new Unit.
        agility - The agility for this new Unit.
        toughness - The toughness for this new Unit.
        weight - The weight for this new Unit.
        initialPosition - The initialPosition for this new Unit.
        enableDefaultBehaviour - The enableDefaultBehaviour for this new Unit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - This method is deprecated, because a Unit needs a World for all of its calculations.
        Note:
        We didn't delete this method because the Facade class still uses this method (and we aren't allowed to change that).

        public void advanceTime(double duration)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Advance the time of the game.
        Parameters:
        duration - The amount of time that has been passed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • moveToAdjacent

        @Raw
public void moveToAdjacent(int dx,
                                 int dy,
                                 int dz)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Move this unit to an adjacent cube.
        Parameters:
        dx - The difference between the x-component of the current cube and the x-component of the destination cube.
        dy - The difference between the y-component of the current cube and the y-component of the destination cube.
        dz - The difference between the z-component of the current cube and the z-component of the destination cube.
        Postcondition:
        The velocity of this Unit is set to {0, 0, -3}, if this Unit is falling and if it can have the newly calculated coordinates as its cube coordinates.
            let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates) && isFalling())
             then for each i in 0..velocity.length:
             if (i == 2)
             then new.getVelocity()[i] == -3
             else new.getVelocity()[i] == 0
        Effects:
      • The resting state of this Unit is disabled, if it was enabled.
            if (isResting())
             then this.setResting(false)
      • The working state of this Unit is disabled, if it was enabled.
            if (isWorking())
             then this.setWorking(false)
      • The moving state of this Unit is enabled if it wasn't enabled already.
            if (!isMoving())
             then this.setMoving(true)
      • The moving to adjacent state is enabled.
            this.setMovingToAdjacent(true)
      • The difference between the current and next position is set to the collection of the given dx, dy and dz value, if this Unit can have the newly calculated cube coordinates as its cube coordinates.
            let
             dCoordinates = {dx, dy, dz},
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates))
             then this.setDeltaNewPositions(dCoordinates)
      • Set the next cube coordinates to the newly calculated coordinates, if this Unit can have these coordinates as its cube coordinates.
            let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates))
             then this.setNextCoordinates(newCoordinates)
      • Set the walking speed of this Unit with the given difference on the z coordinate, if this Unit can have the newly calculated coordinates as its cube coordinates.
            let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates))
             then this.setWalkingSpeed(dz)
      • Calculate the velocity of this Unit using the new coordinates, if this Unit isn't falling and if this Unit can have the newly calculated coordinates as its cube coordinates.
            let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates) && !isFalling())
             then this.setVelocity(newCoordinates)
      • Withdraw 10 hitpoints from this Unit, if this Unit is falling and if it can have the newly calculated coordinates as its cube coordinates.
            let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates) && isFalling())
             then this.setCurrentHitpoints(getCurrentHitpoints() - 10)
      • The orientation of this Unit is set according to the velocity of this Unit, if this Unit can have the newly calculated coordinates as its cube coordinates.
            let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates))
             then this.setOrientation(getVelocity()[0], getVelocity()[1])
      • If this Unit is currently sprinting set the current speed to the sprinting speed. Otherwise set the current speed equal to the walking speed of this Unit. This can only be done if this Unit can have the newly calculated coordiantes as its cube coordinates.
            let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates(),
             newCoordinates = { (coordinates[0] + dx), (coordinates[1] + dy), (coordinates[2] + dz)
            in
             if (canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(newCoordinates))
             then
             if (isSprinting())
             then this.setCurrentSpeed(getSprintingSpeed())
             else this.setCurrentSpeed(getWalkingSpeed())
      • Disable the moving to adjacent state if a condition was violated or an error was thrown.
            catch (Exception e)
             then this.setMovingToAdjacent(false)
      • Disabled the moving state of this Unit is a condition was violated or an error was thrown.
            catch (Exception e)
             then this.setMoving(false)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This Unit cannot move when it's dead. | !isAlive()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this Unit is already moving to an adjacent cube, or if the function is called upon with all of its parameters equal to 0, or if this Unit hasn't rested its initial recovery period, an exception will be thrown. | if ( isMovingToAdjacent() && (dx == 0 && dy == 0 && dz == 0) && !hasRestedInitialRecoveryPeriod() )
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • moveTo

        @Raw
public void moveTo(int[] cube)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Move this unit to the given cube.
        Parameters:
        cube - The given cube to move to.
        Effects:
      • The resting state of this Unit is disabled, if it was already enabled.
            if (isResting())
             then this.setResting(false)
      • The working state of this Unit is disabled, if it was already enabled.
            if (isWorking())
             then this.setWorking(false)
      • The moving state of this Unit is enabled, if it was disabled.
            if (!isMoving())
             then this.setMoving(true)
      • The moving to state of this Unit is enabled.
            this.szetMovingTo(true)
      • The destination cube of this Unit is set to the given cube.
            this.setDestinationCube(cube)
      • The moving to state of this Unit is disabled, if a condition was violated or an error was thrown.
            catch (Exception e)
             then this.setMovingTo(false)
      • The moving state of this Unit is disabled, if a condition was violated or an error was thrown.
            catch (Exception e)
             then this.setMoving(false)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This Unit hasn't rested its initial recovery period or the specified cube is the same as the current cube. | (!hasRestedInitialRecoveryPeriod() && (!Arrays.equals(cube, getCubeCoordinates())))
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This Unit cannot move to a cube if it isn't alive. | !isAlive()

      • die

        @Raw
public void die()
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Let this Unit die.
        Postcondition:
        The new alive state is false.
            new.isAlive() == false
        Effects:
      • Drop the carried Log, if this Unit is carrying a Log.
            if (isCarryingLog())
             dropLog(getPosition())
      • Drop the carried Boulder, if this Unit is carrying a Boulder.
            if (isCarryingBoulder())
             dropBoulder(getPosition())
      • Disable the moving state.
            this.setMoving(false)
      • Disable the working state.
            this.setWorking(false)
      • Disable the attacking state.
            this.setAttacking(false)
      • Disable the defending state.
            this.setDefending(false)
      • Disable the resting state.
            this.setResting(false)
      • Disable the default behaviour.
            this.setDefaultBehaviour(false)
      • Set Faction of this Unit ineffective.
            this.setFaction(null)
      • Set the World of this Unit ineffective.
            this.setWorld(null)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • isValidInitialValue

        public static boolean isValidInitialValue(int value)
        Check whether the given initial value (for strength, agility, weight or toughness) is a valid initial value for any Unit.
        Parameters:
        value - The initial value to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the initial value is between 25 and 100 (inclusive).
            result == ((value >= 25) && (value <= 100))

      • isValidPropertyValue

        public static boolean isValidPropertyValue(int value)
        Check whether the given property value is a valid property value for any Unit.
        Parameters:
        value - The property value to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given property value is between the minimal and maximum property value.
            result == ( (value >= MIN_PROPERTY_VALUE) && (value <= MAX_PROPERTY_VALUE) )

      • getName

        @Basic
 @Raw
public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the name of this Unit.

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
        Check whether the given name is a valid name for any Unit.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the name is more than 2 characters long, starts with an uppercase letter and uses only letters, spaces and quotes (both single and double).
            if ( (name.length() >= MIN_NAMELENGTH) && Character.isUpperCase(name.chartAt(0)) )
             then for each I in 0..name.length():
             let
             current = name.charAt(i)
             in
             if  (!(Character.isLetter(current) || (current == '"') || (current == '\'') || Character.isWhitespace(current)))
             then result == false;
             result == true;
            else
             result == false;

      • setName

        @Raw
public void setName(java.lang.String name)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the name of this Unit to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for this Unit.
        Postcondition:
        The name of this new Unit is equal to the given name.
            new.getName() == name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given name is not a valid name for any Unit. | !isValidName(getName())

        If the given strength is a valid property value for any Unit, the strength of this new Unit is equal to the given strength.
            if (isValidPropertyValue(strength))
              then new.getStrength() == strength

      • canHaveAsWeight

        @Raw

        Check whether this Unit can have the given weight as its weight.
        Parameters:
        weight - The weight to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given weight is a valid property value for any Unit and if the given weight is higher or equal than the default weight.
            result == ( isValidProperyValue(weight) && (weight >= getDefaultWeight()) )

      • setWeight

        @Raw
public void setWeight(int weight)
        Set the weight of this Unit to the given weight or the default weight.
        Parameters:
        weight - The new weight for this Unit.
        Postcondition:
        If this Unit can have the given weight as its weight, the weight of this new Unit is equal to the given weight. Otherwise, the weight of this new Unit is equal to the default weight.
            if (canHaveAsWeight(weight))
              then new.getWeight() == weight
            else
             new.getWeight() == getDefaultWeight()

        Parameters:
        points - The points to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given points is positive.
            result == ( (hitpoints > 0) )

      • getCurrentHitpoints

        @Basic
 @Raw
public int getCurrentHitpoints()
        Return the current hitpoints of this Unit.

      • canHaveAsCurrentHitpoints

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsCurrentHitpoints(int currentHitpoints)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given current hitpoints as its current hitpoints.
        Parameters:
        currentHitpoints - The current hitpoints to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the current hitpoints are a valid hitpoints for any Unit and if they are lower or equal to this Unit's maximum hitpoints.
            result == ( isValidHitpoints(currentHitpoints) && (currentHitpoints <= getMaxHitpoints()))

      • setCurrentHitpoints

        @Raw
public void setCurrentHitpoints(int currentHitpoints)
        Set the currentHitpoints of this Unit to the given currentHitpoints.
        Parameters:
        currentHitpoits - The new current Hitpoints for this Unit.
        Precondition:
        This Unit can have the given current hitpoints as its current hitpoints.
            canHaveAsCurrentHitpoints(currentHitpoits)
        Postcondition:
        The currentHitpoints of this Unit is equal to the given currentHitpoints.
            new.getCurrentHitpoints() == currentHitpoits
        Effect:
        This Unit will die if this Unit can't have the given currentHitpoints as its currentHitpoints, and if the given currentHitpoints is lower than or equal to 0.
            if (!canHaveAsCurrentHitpoints(currentHitpoints)
             then if (currentHitpoints <= 0)
             then this.die()

      • getMaxStaminapoints

        @Basic
 @Raw
 @Immutable
public int getMaxStaminapoints()
        Return the maximum staminapoints of this Unit.

      • getCurrentStaminapoints

        @Basic
 @Raw
public int getCurrentStaminapoints()
        Return the currentStaminapoints of this Unit.

      • canHaveAsCurrentStaminapoints

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsCurrentStaminapoints(int currentStaminapoints)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given current staminapoints as its current staminapoints.
        Parameters:
        currentStaminapoints - The current staminapoints to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the current staminapoints aren't negative and if they are lower or equal to this Unit's maximum staminapoints.
            result == ( (currentStaminapoints >= 0) && (currentStaminapoints <= getMaxHitpoints()) )
        Note:
        As opposed to current hitpoints, we do implement equal to zero in this checker, because the current staminapoints should be able to reach zero, at which point a Unit can't sprint anymore.

      • setCurrentStaminapoints

        @Raw
public void setCurrentStaminapoints(int currentStaminapoints)

        Parameters:
        currentStaminapoints - The new currentStaminapoints for this Unit.
        Precondition:
        The given currentStaminapoints must be a valid currentStaminapoints for any Unit.
            canHaveAsCurrentStaminapoints(currentStaminapoints)
        Postcondition:
        The currentStaminapoints of this Unit is equal to the given currentStaminapoints.
            new.getCurrentStaminapoints() == currentStaminapoints

      • getCubeCoordinates

        @Basic
 @Raw
public int[] getCubeCoordinates()
        Return the current cube coordinates in which this Unit is located.
        Returns:
        The given array length is equals to the array length of this Unit's current cube coordinates.
            result.lenght == this.cubeCoordinates.length;
        Returns:
        Each elemen of the resulting array corresponds with the element of this Unit's current cube coordinates at the corresponding index.
            for each i in 0..result.length:
             result[i] == this.cubeCoordinates[i]

      • canHaveAsCubeCoordinates

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(int[] coordinates)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given current cube coordinates as its current cube coordinates.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The cube coordinates to check.
        Returns:
        If this Unit is dead, true if and only if the given cube coordinates are ineffective. Otherwise, true if and only if the given cube coordinates are within the boundaries of this Unit's World and if the given cube coordinates correspond to a passable cube.
            if (!isAlive())
             result == (coordinates == null)
            else
             result == ( getWorld().isBetweenBoundaries(coordinates[0], coordinates[1], coordinates[2])
             && getWorld().isPassableCube(coordinates[0], coordinates[1], coordinates[2]) )

      • setCubeCoordinates

        @Raw
public void setCubeCoordinates(int[] cubeCoordinates)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the current cube coordinates of this Unit to the given cube coordinates.
        Parameters:
        cubeCoordinates - The new cube coordinates for this Unit.
        Postcondition:
        The current cube coordinates of this new Unit is equal to the given cube coordinates.
            new.getCubeCoordinates() == cubeCoordinates
        Effect:
        Set the precise position of this Unit according to the given cube coordinates.
            this.setPosition(cubeCoordinates)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Unit cannot have the given cube coordinates as its current cube coordinates. | !canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(cubeCoordinates)
        Note:
        We immediately update the position of this Unit if we change its coordinates. This is because these properties work along with one another.

      • isFalling

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isFalling()
        Return the falling state of this Unit.

      • canHaveAsFalling

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsFalling(boolean isFalling)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given falling state as its falling state.
        Parameters:
        isFalling - The falling state to check.
        Returns:
        If this Unit is dead, true if and only if the given falling state is false. Otherwise, true if and only if the given falling state is true and the current cube coordinates of this Unit don't have a solid neighbouring cube, or if the given falling state is false and the current cube coordinates of this Unit do have a solid neighbouring cube.
            if (!isAlive)
             result == (!isFalling)
            else
             let
             coordinates = getCubeCoordinates()
             in
             result == ( (isFalling && !(getWorld().hasSolidNeighbouringCube((coordinates[0], coordinates[1], coordinates[2]))))
             || (!isFalling && getWorld().hasSolidNeighbouringCube((coordinates[0], coordinates[1], coordinates[2]))) )

      • setFallingState

public void setFallingState(boolean isFalling)

        Parameters:

        Postcondition:
        The falling state of this new Unit is equal to the given falling state.
            new.isFalling() == isFalling
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Unit cannot have the given falling state as its falling state. | !canHaveAsIsFalling(getisFalling())

      • getPosition

        @Basic
 @Raw
public double[] getPosition()
        Return the position of this Unit.
        Returns:
        The length of the resulting array is equals to the length of this Unit's position array.
            result.length == this.position.length
        Returns:
        Each element of the resulting array equals with the elemen of this Unit's position array at the corresponding index.
            for each i in 0..result.length:
             result[i] == this.position[i]

      • setPosition

        @Raw
public void setPosition(int[] coordinates)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Calculate the precise position with the given cube coordinates.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The cube coordinates used to calculate the new position of this Unit.
        Postcondition:
        Each element of the position of this Unit is equal to the sum of the corresponding element of the given coordinates and the cubelength of any World divided by 2.
            for each i in 0..coordinates.length:
             new.position[i] == (coordinates[i] + (World.getCubeLength() / 2.0))
        Effects:
      • Enable the falling state of this Unit, if it must fall with the current cube coordinates.
            if (mustUnitFall(getCubeCoordinates())
             then this.setFallingState(true)
      • Disable the falling state of this Unit, if the unit is currently falling.
            if (isFalling())
             then this.setFallingState(false)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Unit cannot have the given coordinates as its cubeCoordinates. | ! canHaveAsCubeCoordinates(coordinates)

      • canHaveAsPositionAt

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsPositionAt(int index,
                                         double value)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given position value at the given index of its position.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        index - The index of which component must be used in the checker.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given value is between the lower boundary of this World and either the amount of x cubes, y cubes or z cubes of this World depending on the given index of the position.
            if (index == 0)
             then result == ( (value >= getWorld().getLowerBoundary()) && (value < getWorld().getNbCubesX()) )
            else if (index == 1)
             then result == ( (value >= getWorld().getLowerBoundary()) && (value < getWorld().getNbCubesY()) )
            else if (index == 2)
             then result == ( (value >= getWorld().getLowerBoundary()) && (value < getWorld().getNbCubesZ()) )
            else
             result == false

      • setPositionAt

        @Raw
public void setPositionAt(int index,
                                double value)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Set the value of this Unit's position at the given index equal to the given value.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the position component to be changed.
        value - The new value for this Unit's position component.
        Postcondition:
        The value of the element of the position with the given index is equal to the given value.
            new.getPosition()[index] == value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Unit cannot have the given value as its value for its position at the given index. | !canHaveAsUnitPositionValue(value)
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This Unit is dead. | !isAlive()

      • getCurrentSpeed

        Return the current speed of this Unit.

      • canHaveAsCurrentSpeed

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsCurrentSpeed(double currentSpeed)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given current speed as its current speed.
        Parameters:
        currentSpeed - The current speed to check.
        Returns:
        If this Unit is dead, true if and only if the given current speed is zero. Otherwise, true if and only if the current speed is either the Unit's walking speed, the Unit's sprinting speed or zero.+
            if (!isAlive())
             then result == (currentSpeed == 0)
            else
             result == ((currentSpeed == getWalkingSpeed()) || (currentSpeed == getSprintSpeed()))

      • isSprinting

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isSprinting()
        Return the sprinting state of this Unit.

      • canHaveAsSprintingState

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsSprintingState(boolean isSprinting)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given sprinting state as its sprinting state.
        Parameters:
        isSprinting - The sprinting state to check.
        Returns:
        If this Unit is dead, true if and only if the given sprinting state is false. Otherwise, true if and only if the given sprinting state is true and this Unit is currently moving or if the given spriting state is false.
            if (!isAlive())
             then result == (!isFalling)
            else
             result == ( (isSprinting && isMoving()) || !isSprinting )

      • startSprinting

        @Raw
public void startSprinting()
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Let this Unit sprint.
        Effects:
      • The sprinting state of this Unit is enabled, if its current staminapoints is higher than 0, if the Unit is currently moving, and if the Unit isn't falling.
            if ( (getCurrentStaminapoints() > 0) && isMoving() && !isFalling() )
             then this.setIsSprinting(true)
      • The current speed of this Unit is set to its sprint speed, if its current staminapoints is higher than 0, if the Unit is currently moving, and if the Unit isn't falling.
            if ( (getCurrentStaminapoints() > 0) && isMoving() && !isFalling() )
             then this.setCurrentSpeed(getSprintSpeed())
      • The velocity of this Unit is set to the calculated velocity using this Unit's cube coordinates, if its currentStaminapoints is higher than 0, if the Unit is currently moving, if the Unit isn't falling and if the isDefaultBehaviourEnabled indicator is deactivated.
            if ( (getCurrentStaminapoints() > 0) && isMoving() && !isFalling() && !isDefaultBehaviourEnabled() )
             then this.setVelocity(getNextCubeCoordinates())
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • stopSprinting

        @Raw
public void stopSprinting()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Let this Unit stop sprinting.
        Effects:
      • The isSprinting indicator of this Unit is disabled, if this Unit is currently moving.
            if (isMoving())
             then this.setIsSprinting(false)
      • The current speed of this Unit is set to its walking speed, if this Unit is currently moving.
            if (isMoving())
             then this.setCurrentSpeed(getWalkingSpeed())
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

        Check whether this Unit can have the given moving state as its moving state.
        Parameters:
        isMoving - The moving state to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given moving state is true and the Unit isn't currently attacking or if the given moving state is false.
            result == ((isMoving && !isAttacking()) || !isMoving)

      • isWorking

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isWorking()
        Check whether this Unit is working.

      • canHaveAsIsWorking

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsIsWorking(boolean isWorking)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given working state as its working state.
        Parameters:
        isWorking - The working state to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the Unit isn't currently moving or attacking or defending.
            result == ((!isMoving() || !isAttacking() || !isDefending)

      • work

        @Raw
public void work()
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Make this Unit work.
        Effects:
      • The resting indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if the Unit isn't moving, attacking or already working and if the Unit has completed the initial resting period and if the Unit is currently resting.
            if ((!(isMoving() || isAttacking()) && !isWorking()) && hasRestedOnePoint() && isResting())
            then this.setIsResting(false)
      • The working indicator of this Unit is enabled, only if the Unit isn't moving, attacking or already working and if the Unit has completed the initial resting period.
            if (!(isMoving() || isAttacking()) && !isWorking() && hasRestedOnePoint())
            then this.setWorking(true)
      • The working duration of this Unit is set to 500 divided by its strength, only if the Unit isn't moving, attacking or already working and if the Unit has completed the initial restin)g period.
            if (!(isMoving() || isAttacking() && !isWorking() && hasRestedOnePoint())
            then this.setWorkingDuration(500/getStrength())
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Unit is moving, attacking, already working or didn't rest its initial recovery period yet. | !(isMoving() || isAttacking()) && !isWorking() && hasRestedOnePoint()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • workAt

        @Raw
public void workAt(int x,
                         int y,
                         int z)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Make this Unit work at a given cube.
        Parameters:
        x - The given x coordinate of the target cube.
        y - The given y coordinate of the target cube.
        z - The given z coordinate of the target cube.
        Effects:
      • Set the target cube to the given cube coordinates, if the Unit isn't already working.
            if (!isWorking())
             then
              targetCube = {x, y, z}
              this.setTargetCube(targetCube)
      • The orientation is set to the arctangens of the difference between the given y coordinate and the current y coordinate and the difference between the given x coordinate and the current x coordinate, if the Unit isn't already working.
            if (!isWorking())
             then this.setOrientation((y - getCubeCoordinates()[1]), (x - getCubeCoordinates[0]))
      • If the Unit isn't already working, let the Unit work.
            if (!isWorking())
             then this.work()
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

            if (!isAlive())
             then result == (log == null)
            else
             result == ( (log == null) || !isCarryingBoulder() )

            result == ( canHaveAsLog(getLog()) && ( (log == null) || getWorld().hasAsLog(getLog()) ) )

 @Raw

        @Raw

        Check whether this Unit can have the given Boulder as its Boulder.
        Parameters:
        boulder - The Boulder to check.
        Returns:
        If this Unit is dead, true if and only if the given Boulder is ineffective. Otherwise, true if and only if the given boulder is ineffective or if this Unit isn't already carrying a Log.
            if (!isAlive())
             then result == (boulder == null)
            else
             result == ( (boulder == null) || (!isCarryingLog()) )

      • hasProperBoulder

        public boolean hasProperBoulder()
        Check whether this Unit has a proper Boulder attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Unit can have its Boulder as its Boulder and if that Boulder is either ineffective or if it is part of this Unit's World.
            result == ( canHaveAsBoulder(getBoulder()) && ( (boulder == null) || getWorld().hasBoulder(getBoulder()) ) )

      • isAttacking

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isAttacking()
        Check whether this Unit is attacking another Unit.

      • isDefending

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isDefending()
        Check whether this Unit is defending itself.

      • attack

        @Raw
public void attack(Unit defender)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Attack another Unit.
        Parameters:
        defender - The Unit that's being attacked.
        Effects:
      • The isWorking indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from different Factions and if the given Unit doesn't equal this Unit and if the isWorking indicator is enabled.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), defender.getCubeCoordinates())
             && defender.getFaction() != getFaction() && defender != this && isWorking())
             then this.setIsWorking(false)
      • The isResting indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from different Factions and if the given Unit doesn't equal this Unit and if the isResting indicator is enabled.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), defender.getCubeCoordinates()) && defender.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && defender != this && isResting())
             then this.setIsResting(false)
      • The orientation of this Unit is set to the arctangent of the difference of the y-component of the other Unit and the y-component of this Unit and the difference of the x-component of the other Unit and the x-component of this Unit, only if both Units are next to each other and if they are from different Factions.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), defender.getCubeCoordinates()) && defender.getFaction() != getFaction())
             then this.setOrientation(Math.atan2(defender.getUnitPosition()[1] - getUnitPosition()[1],
             defender.getUnitPosition()[0] - getUnitPosition()[0]))
      • The isAttacking indicator of this Unit is enabled, only if both Units are next to each other and if they are from different Factions.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), defender.getCubeCoordinates()) && defender.getFaction() != getFaction())
             then this.setIsAttacking(true)
      • The isMoving indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if both Units are next to each other and if they are from different Factions and if this Unit is currently moving.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), defender.getCubeCoordinates()) && defender.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && isMoving())
             then this.setIsMoving(false)
      • The wasMoving indicator of this Unit is enabled, only if both Units are next to each other and if they are from different Factions and if this Unit is currently moving.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), defender.getCubeCoordinates()) && defender.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && isMoving())
             then this.setWasMoving(true)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown. Both Units aren't next to each other or they are in the same faction, thus they can't attack each other. | if (!World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), defender.getCubeCoordinates()) && defender.getFaction() == getFaction())

      • defend

        @Raw
public void defend(Unit attacker)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Defend from the attack of another Unit.
        Parameters:
        attacker - The Unit that is attacking this Unit.
        Effects:
      • The isWorking indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from different Factions and if the isWorking indicator is enabled.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && isWorking())
             then this.setIsWorking(false)
      • The isResting indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from different Factions and if the isResting indicator is enabled.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && isResting())
             then this.setIsResting(false)
      • The isDefending indicator of this Unit is enabled, only if both Units are next to each other and if they are from different Factions.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction())
             then this.setIsDefending(true)
      • The orientation of this Unit is set to the arctangent of the difference of the y-component of the other Unit and the y-component of this Unit and the difference of the x-component of the other Unit and the x-component of this Unit, only if both Units are next to each other and if they are from different Factions.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction())
             then this.setOrientation(Math.atan2(attacker.getUnitPosition()[1] - getUnitPosition()[1],
             attacker.getUnitPosition()[0] - getUnitPosition()[0]))
      • The current hitpoints of this Unit is set to the difference between its current hitpoints and the other Unit's strength divided by 10, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from differen Factions and if this Unit didn't block or dodge the attack.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && !Dodged(attacker) && !Blocked(attacker))
             then this.setCurrentHitpoints(getCurrentHitpoints() - (attacker.getStrength() / 10.0))
      • The isMoving indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from differen Factions and if this Unit is currently moving.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && isMoving())
             then this.setIsMoving(false)
      • The wasMoving indicator of this Unit is enabled, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from different Factions and if this Unit is currently moving.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction()
              && isMoving())
             then this.setWasMoving(true)
      • The experience of this Unit is set to the sum of the current experience and 20, only if both Units are next to each other, if they are from different Factions and if this Unit has either dogded or blocked the incoming attack.
            if (World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction()
             && (hasDogded() || hasBlocked()))
             then this.setExperience(getExperience() + 20)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an eeror was thrown. Both Units aren't next to each other or are from the same Faction, thus they can't attack each other. | if (!World.isNeighbouringCube(getCubeCoordinates(), attacker.getCubeCoordinates()) && attacker.getFaction() != getFaction())

 @Raw

      • canHaveAsIsResting

        public boolean canHaveAsIsResting(boolean isResting)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given resting state as its resting state.
        Parameters:
        isResting - The resting state to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given isResting indicator is enabled and this Unit isn't currently attacking or defending or if the given isResting indicator is false.
            result == ( (isResting && (!isAttacking() || !isDefending())) || !isResting )

      • rest

        @Raw
public void rest()
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Make this Unit rest.
        Effects:
      • The isWorking indicator of this Unit is disabled, only if this Unit isn't attacking and if this Unit's current hitpoints are lower than the max hitpoints and if this Unit's current staminapoints is lower than the max staminapoints and if the Unit isn't already Resting and if the Unit is working.
            if (!isAttacking() && (getCurrentHitpoints() < getMaxHitpoints() || getCurrentStaminapoints() < getMaxStaminapoints())
             && !isResting() && isWorking())
             then this.setIsWorking(false)
      • The isResting indicator of this Unit is enabled, only if this Unit isn't attacking and if this Unit's current hitpoints are lower than the max hitpoints or if this Unit's current stamina points is lower than the max staminapoints and if the Unit isn't already resting.
            if (!isAttacking() && (getCurrentHitpoints() < getMaxHitpoints() || getCurrentStaminapoints() < getMaxStaminapoints())
             && !isResting())
             then this.setIsResting(true)
      • The restingDuration of this Unit is set to 0, only if this Unit isn't attacking and if this Unit's current hitpoints are lower than the max hitpoints or if this Unit's current stamina points is lower than the max staminapoints and if the Unit isn't already resting.
            if (!isAttacking() && (getCurrentHitpoints() < getMaxHitpoints() || getCurrentStaminapoints() < getMaxStaminapoints())
             && !isResting())
             then this.setRestingDuration(0)
      • The tempHitpoint of this Unit is set to 0, only if this Unit isn't attacking and if this Unit's current hitpoints are lower than the max hitpoints or if this Unit's current stamina points is lower than the max staminapoints and if the Unit isn't already resting.
            if (!isAttacking() && (getCurrentHitpoints() < getMaxHitpoints() || getCurrentStaminapoints() < getMaxStaminapoints())
             && !isResting())
             then this.setTempHitpoint(0)
      • The tempStaminapoint of this Unit is set to 0, only if this Unit isn't attacking and if this Unit's current hitpoints are lower than the max hitpoints or if this Unit's current stamina points is lower than the max staminapoints and if the Unit isn't already resting.
            if (!isAttacking() && (getCurrentHitpoints() < getMaxHitpoints() || getCurrentStaminapoints() < getMaxStaminapoints())
             && !isResting())
             then this.setTempStaminapoint(0)
      • The isMoving indicator is disabled, only if this Unit isn't attacking and if this Unit's current hitpoits are lower than the max hitpoints or if this Unit's current staminapoints are lower than the max staminapoints and if the Unit isn't already resting and if the Unit is currently moving.
            if (!isAttacking() && (getCurrentHitpoints() < getMaxHitpoints() || getCurrentStaminapoints() < getMaxStaminapoints())
             && !isResting() && isMoving())
             then this.setIsMoving(false)
      • The wasMoving indicator is enabled, only if this Unit isn't attacking and if this Unit's current hitpoints are kiwer than the max hitpoints or if this Unit's current staminapoints are lower than the max staminapoints and if the Unit isn't already resting and if the Unit is currently moving.
            if (!isAttacking() && (getCurrentHitpoints() < getMaxHitpoints() || getCurrentStaminapoints() < getMaxStaminapoints())
             && !isResting() && isMoving())
             then this.setWasMoving(true)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • getFaction

 @Raw

      • setFaction

        @Raw
public void setFaction(Faction faction)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the faction of this unit to the given faction.
        Parameters:
        faction - The new Faction for this unit.
        Postcondition:
        The faction of this new unit is equal to the given faction.
            new.getFaction() == faction
        Effect:
        Add this Unit to given Faction, if the given Faction is effective.
            if (faction != null)
             then this.getFaction().addUnit(this)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Unit cannot have the given Faction as one of its Factions. | ! canHaveAsFaction(getFaction())

      • hasProperFaction

        public boolean hasProperFaction()
        Check whether this Unit has a proper Faction attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Unit can have its Faction as its Faction and if this Faction has this Unit as its Unit.
            result == ( (getFaction() == null) || (canHaveAsFaction(getFaction()) && getFaction().hasAsUnit(this)) )

      • isAlive

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isAlive()
        Check whether this Unit is alive.

      • getWorld

        @Basic
 @Raw
public World getWorld()
        Return the World to which this Unit is attached.

      • canHaveAsWorld

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsWorld(World world)
        Check if this Unit can have the given World as the World to which it is attached.
        Parameters:
        world - The World to check.
        Returns:
        If this Unit is dead, true if and only if the given World is ineffective. Otherwise, true if and only if the given World is effective and if that World can have this Unit as one of its Units.
            if (!isAlive())
             then result == (world == null)
            else
             result == ( (world != null) && world.canHaveAsUnit(this) )

      • hasProperWorld

        public boolean hasProperWorld()
        Check whether this Unit has a proper World to which it is attached.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Unit can have its World as the World to which it is attached and if that World has this Unit as one of its Units.
            if ( (!canHaveAsWorld(getWorld())) && (!getWorld().hasAsUnit(this)) )
             then result == false
            else
             result == true

      • getTask

        @Basic
 @Raw
public Task getTask()
        Return the Task that is assigned to this Unit.

      • canHaveAsTask

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsTask(Task task)
        Check whether this Unit can have the given Task as its assigned Task.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Task is ineffective or if it is effective and listed as one of the Tasks of the Scheduler of this Unit's Faction.
            if (task == null)
             result == true
            else
             result == getFaction().getScheduler().hasAsTask(task)

      • setTask

        @Raw
public void setTask(Task task)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Assign the given Task as this Unit's Task.
        Parameters:
        task - The given Task to assign.
        Postcondition:
        The Task of this Unit is equal to the given Task.
            new.getTask() == task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Unit cannot have the given Task as its assigned Task | !canHaveAsTask(task)

      • hasProperTask

        public boolean hasProperTask()
        Check whether this Unit has a proper Task assigned to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Unit can have its Task as its Task, if this Unit is alive and if the Task has this Unit as its Unit or if this Unit is dead.
            if (canHaveAsTask(getTask())
             then
             if (isAlive())
             then result == ( getTask().getUnit() == this )
             else
             result == true
            else
             result == false
